source:
# Copy the file from ADLS Gen2 to local file system
storage_account = mssparkutils.notebook.run('/utils/py_utils_get_storage_account')
source_path = f"abfss://odw-config@{storage_account}/NSIP Service Bus and ODW Data Dictionaries.xlsx"
local_path = "/tmp/NSIP_Service_Bus_and_ODW_Data_Dictionaries.xlsx"

# Copy the file
mssparkutils.fs.cp(source_path, f"file:{local_path}", recurse=False)

import pandas as pd

# Load the sheet
df_standardised = pd.read_excel(local_path, sheet_name="Standardised", engine="openpyxl")

# Filter for 'Table Name' == 'sb_nsip_project'
filtered_df = df_standardised[df_standardised["Table Name"] == "sb_nsip_project"]

# Extract the values under 'Attribute Name' column
attribute_names = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()

# Convert Pandas column values to a list of expected column names
expected_columns = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()

# Load the Spark table
df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `odw_standardised_db`.`sb_nsip_project`")
actual_columns = df.columns

# Compare: find extra columns in the Spark table
extra_columns = [col for col in actual_columns if col not in expected_columns]

# Compare: find missing columns in the Spark table
missing_columns = [col for col in expected_columns if col not in actual_columns]

print("Extra columns in the table:")
print(extra_columns)

print("Missing columns in the table:")
print(missing_columns)

import pandas as pd

# Load the sheet
df_Harmonised = pd.read_excel(local_path, sheet_name="Harmonised", engine="openpyxl")

# Filter for 'Table Name' == 'sb_nsip_project'
filtered_df = df_Harmonised[df_Harmonised["Table Name"] == "nsip_project"]

# Extract the values under 'Attribute Name' column
attribute_names = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()

# Expected and actual columns
expected_columns_cs = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()
actual_columns_cs = df.columns

# Case-insensitive sets
expected_lower_set = {col.lower() for col in expected_columns_cs}
actual_lower_set = {col.lower() for col in actual_columns_cs}

# Missing columns (case-insensitive)
missing_columns = [col for col in expected_columns_cs if col.lower() not in actual_lower_set]

# Extra columns (case-insensitive)
extra_columns = [col for col in actual_columns_cs if col.lower() not in expected_lower_set]

# Case mismatch columns (present in both sets but different case)
case_mismatch = [
    (exp, act)
    for exp in expected_columns_cs
    for act in actual_columns_cs
    if exp.lower() == act.lower() and exp != act
]

print("Extra columns in the table:")
print(extra_columns)

print("\nMissing columns in the table:")
print(missing_columns)

print("\nColumns with case mismatch:")
print(case_mismatch)

import pandas as pd

# Load the sheet
df_Curated= pd.read_excel(local_path, sheet_name="Curated", engine="openpyxl")

# Filter for 'Table Name' == 'sb_nsip_project'
filtered_df = df_Curated[df_Curated["Table Name"] == "nsip_project"]

# Extract the values under 'Attribute Name' column
attribute_names = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()

# Convert expected columns from Pandas DataFrame to lowercase set
expected_columns = set(filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().str.lower())

# Load Spark table and convert column names to lowercase set
df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `odw_curated_db`.`nsip_project`")
actual_columns = set(col.lower() for col in df.columns)

# Find extra and missing columns (case-insensitive)
extra_columns = actual_columns - expected_columns
missing_columns = expected_columns - actual_columns

# Print results
print("Extra columns in the table:", list(extra_columns))
print("Missing columns in the table:", list(missing_columns))

# Expected and actual columns
expected_columns_cs = filtered_df["Attribute Name"].dropna().tolist()
actual_columns_cs = df.columns

# Case-insensitive sets
expected_lower_set = {col.lower() for col in expected_columns_cs}
actual_lower_set = {col.lower() for col in actual_columns_cs}

# Missing columns (case-insensitive)
missing_columns = [col for col in expected_columns_cs if col.lower() not in actual_lower_set]

# Extra columns (case-insensitive)
extra_columns = [col for col in actual_columns_cs if col.lower() not in expected_lower_set]

# Case mismatch columns (present in both sets but different case)
case_mismatch = [
    (exp, act)
    for exp in expected_columns_cs
    for act in actual_columns_cs
    if exp.lower() == act.lower() and exp != act
]

print("Extra columns in the table:")
print(extra_columns)

print("\nMissing columns in the table:")
print(missing_columns)

print("\nColumns with case mismatch:")
print(case_mismatch)
